image.altText: Photos of the roof of an old church.

props.synopsis: When Simon was a student at a Catholic boys' school in Hobart in the 1970s, he says the school was run in an "archaic, cruel" manner, and one of the teachers had a name for the strap that he would use to hit them.

title.children: Class action planned over alleged 'cruel' punishment at Catholic school

image.altText: Denieka Dewar and Kaylem Hardy with their two children in a bushy area

props.synopsis: Tasmania has the worst childcare access in Australia, with more than half the state considered a "childcare desert". A service at risk of closure says while election promises are encouraging, they don't go far enough.

title.children: Major parties take aim at Tasmania's childcare 'desert' to sway votes

image.altText: Two men talking at each other.

props.synopsis: Ahead of Saturday's Tasmanian election, Liberal Premier Jeremy Rockliff and Labor leader Dean Winter debated the issues. Both parties claimed success for their respective leaders, but what did we learn?Â

title.children: Budget, Spirit of Tasmania ferries covered in debate with few surprises

image.altText: A young man with curly blonde hair wears an apron and holds his arms up to display his biceps.

props.synopsis: The mother of a 21-year-old footballer who died in 2023 has told a court how her son's condition quickly declined the day after he suffered a head injury.

title.children: Mother of young footballer tells inquest of rapid decline after mystery injury

image.altText: hand puts a ballot into a voting ballot box

props.synopsis: Where can I vote? Can I take a selfie while doing it? Who are the candidates? All your questions about the Tasmanian state election answered.

title.children: Your questions about Tasmania's election answered

image.altText: Smoke risies in the distance between buildings

props.synopsis: At least one person has died after air strikes on the Syrian capital of Damascus.Â

title.children: Israel strikes Syria's military HQ and area near presidential palace

image.altText: A group of people pose for a photo, all are blurred except for Erin Scutter in the front row, wearing a pink top.

props.synopsis: The aviation sector has been home to two of the nation's most high-profile murderers, however, documents reveal Airservices Australia and CASA have not reviewed their systems of psychometric testing.

title.children: No aviation psychometric testing review after Erin Patterson, Greg Lynn cases

image.altText: A number of people cross an intersection in Brisbane's CBD. Behind them are office buildings.

props.synopsis: The Aussie dollar has fallen back below 65 US cents, and the share market has added to gains, on unexpectedly weak jobs numbers. US President Donald Trump says he is not planning to fire Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Aussie dollar falls as unemployment unexpectedly rises

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Markets see 84pc chance of August rate cut
Sharp rise makes RBA July hold look like 'policy error': Capital Economics
4.3pc is highest unemployment rate since late 2021

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese has visited a panda conservation centre in China as he finishes his six-day trip to the country. Follow live.

title.children: Panda diplomacy on display during PM's final day of China visit

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: 'Long live the Australia-US alliance': Cash demands PM turn focus to America

image.altText: An Aboriginal child in a black adidas shirt holding an Aboriginal toddler in a white and balck shirt, on a basketball court

props.synopsis: The Kumanjayi Walker Inquest backs Aboriginal-led solutions and restoring Warlpiri self-determination, which his family says will "prevent deaths in custody".

title.children: Police shooting of Kumanjayi Walker could lead NT communities taking back full control

image.altText: A man and a woman inside a camper van.

props.synopsis: Outback murderer Bradley Murdoch's death could present a fresh opportunity to find the remains of his victim, British backpacker Peter Falconio, according to a leading forensic expert.

title.children: Killer's death presents 'opportunity' to find Falconio's remains

image.altText: A screenshot showing how the darcula v3 software works.

props.synopsis: Sophisticated subscription services that use multiple languages and can mimic legitimate brands are being used by criminals to trick consumers into visiting fake websites.

title.children: New software 'Darcula' makes scams easier with convincing fake websites

image.altText: A soldier in camouflage fatigues looks down the sights of a rifle during a drill held near school buildings.

props.synopsis: Taiwan, wary of increasing pressure from Beijing, has beefed up its defence drills and is training citizens of all ages to be ready for any forceful attempts to make it join the People's Republic of China.

title.children: Taiwan runs largest defence drills as pressure from Beijing mounts

image.altText: A person in a hard hat works on a huge metal pipe system inside a concrete tunnel, with a bike to one side.

props.synopsis: Current models of physics dictate there should be as much antimatter in the universe as matter, but there isn't. Work at the world's largest particle collider has come a step closer to explaining why.Â

title.children: Atom smasher spots new clue to explain why the universe exists

image.altText: Colouring pencils in a plastic container.

props.synopsis: The 21-year-old man is alleged to have committed the offence last week at a childcare centre operated by Affinity Education Group.

title.children: Brisbane childcare worker charged with indecent treatment of 4yo

image.altText: A huge fire engulfs a large stage with huge ice-like decorations

props.synopsis: Organisers say they are "finding solutions for the festival weekend", which is now just days away.

title.children: Tomorrowland's main stage catches fire days before festival

image.altText: A small shark in the water, attached to a fishing line

props.synopsis: Researchers were "beginning to wonder if they even existed", but have finally found a new species of worm parasite on a shark after a 20-year worldwide search.

title.children: Rare worm parasite, first of its kind, found feasting on shark

image.altText: Woman laughing behind the wheel of a large vehicle.

props.synopsis: Heather Ewart was a powerhouse political reporter when she was asked to create a show about regional Australia. A decade later, and with her final season going to air, Ewart admits that getting the idea off the ground was no easy feat.

title.children: Heather Ewart signs off from Back Roads after 10 years telling tales from the bush

image.altText: Red Westpac logo in background with phone showing NAB bank app in focus.

props.synopsis: A remote chamber of commerce reports multiple businesses in the same town falling victim to bank impersonation scams.

title.children: Big banks warn businesses of Kimberley scam cluster

image.altText: Audun GrÃ¸nvold poses with his medal at the 2010 Vancouver Winter Olympics.

props.synopsis: Olympic ski cross medallist Audun GrÃ¸nvold dies, aged 49, after being struck by lightning while on holiday.

title.children: Norwegian Olympic medallist dies after being struck by lightning

image.altText: A man with an Australian flag bandana brandishes a piece of paper

props.synopsis: Southern Cross University provides research funding to a conspiracy theorist who has wrongly claimed fire ant bait causes ADHD, autism, and low fertility in humans.

title.children: Fire ant conspiracy theorist gets uni funding for field work

image.altText: A tall person walking alongside a smaller woman with blonde hair.

props.synopsis: It's hoped the ACT Health pilot program, beginning in six months, will reduce the number of Canberrans facing lengthy waits for an attention deficit hyperactivity disorder diagnosis.

title.children: 'Aren't enough': Some Canberra GPs will soon be allowed to diagnose ADHD

image.altText: An ankle monitor used by WA Police

props.synopsis: Months after issues emerged with the rollout of mandatory GPS tracking of domestic violence offenders, the WA government promises to fund 38 more staff.Â

title.children: Government seeks help after downplaying staffing fears on DV monitoring

image.altText: A large lizard with it's mouth open to the camera.

props.synopsis: Ecologist Kristoffer Wild spent a year in the Australian outback fitting bearded dragons with hand-sewn jackets with GPS trackers to track every second of the lizards' lives.

title.children: Bearded dragons in backpacks reveal speed can be a killer

image.altText: A close up of a woman with a white dress and pixie cut

props.synopsis: Watson, 35, was banned for driving at 38 miles per hour (61kph) in a 30-mile zone in south-east England.

title.children: Harry Potter actress Emma Watson banned from driving after speeding

image.altText: A person pouring a cup of water into the hands of a monk.

props.synopsis: A Central Investigation Bureau deputy commissioner says the investigation began last month after an abbot of a famous temple in Bangkok abruptly left the monkhood.

title.children: Thai woman arrested for allegedly seducing and blackmailing Buddhist monks

image.altText: Police tape with a closed police scene behind it, there are officers on the road

props.synopsis: Police on the NSW Central Coast arrived at an address to find a man standing in the middle of the road armed with a knife. They deployed a taser but the man got into his car and allegedly rammed a patrol vehicle.

title.children: Man shot in arm by police after alleged DV assault

image.altText: Middle aged man pointing into a wetland with his black dog.

props.synopsis: The once-degraded Heart Morass wetland in eastern Victoria is now thriving as research shows restoring wetlands could be a powerful tool in fighting carbon emissions and guarding against floods and drought.

title.children: Community-led wetlands revival goes to heart of climate fight

image.altText: A blue sculpture among pavers and trees.

props.synopsis: A controversial sculpture that sparked complaints about its cost and design arrives in Mount Gambier to a positive reception.

title.children: 'Blue blob' or 'beloved new landmark'? It's got this city talking

image.altText: Empty bed at Royal Brisbane and Women's Hospital

props.synopsis: Elective surgeries have been paused for 48 hours while resources are diverted to emergency departments.

title.children: Elective surgeries paused at major Qld hospitals 'overwhelmed' by flu cases

image.altText: A group of young pelicans stand in the water of a lagoon

props.synopsis:
After decades of environmental degradation, South Australia's internationally significant Coorong wetlands are now at risk of becoming a "wasteland" due to the state's toxic algal bloom, advocates fear.

Â

title.children: Coorong 'on the brink' amid fears algal bloom could be final straw

image.altText: A protester runs out on the course during a Tour de France stage.

props.synopsis: Defending champion Tadej PogaÄar is involved in a crash at the Tour de France moments before a protester disrupts the sprint finish where Norway's Jonas Abrahamsen claims his first stage victory.

title.children: PogaÄar crashes before anti-Israel protester disrupts TDF stage finale

image.altText: Paul Gallen declared winner by split decision following his main event boxing match against Sonny Bill Williams.

props.synopsis: Paul Gallen scores a split-points win over Sonny Bill Williams in their long-awaited heavyweight boxing bout in Sydney.

title.children: Gallen wins points verdict in hyped fight with SBW

image.altText: A bespectacled RAYE & Mark Ronson sit posing at an upright piano

props.synopsis: Hit-maker Mark Ronson has collaborated with everyone from Lady Gaga and Bruno Mars to the late, great Amy Winehouse. Now he's added another name to his CV: breakout talent Raye.

title.children: Has Mark Ronson found his next Amy Winehouse?
